required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of Irinotecan Hydrochloride (Campto(R)) And Cisplatin Versus Etoposide And Cisplatin In Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Open Label, Randomised Multicentre Phase III Study Of Irinotecan Hydrochloride (Campto (Registered)) And Cisplatin Versus Etoposide And Cisplatin In Chemotherapy Naive Patients With Extensive Disease - Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effects of irinotecan hydrochloride with cisplatin to the "standard" regimen etoposide plus cisplatin on overall survival, in chemotherapy-naive patients with newly diagnosed Extensive Disease-Small Cell Lung Cancer (ED-SCLC).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) for the Full Analysis Population (FAP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death (every 3 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months for a minimum of 13 months post study treatment)

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival for the Per Protocol (PP) Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death (every 3 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months for a minimum of 13 months post study treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Overall Confirmed Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to first documentation of confirmed response (every 9 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months in follow up until progression)
Baseline to first documentation of confirmed response (every 9 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months in follow up until progression)
Baseline to date of progression (every 9 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months for a minimum of 13 months post study treatment until progression)

secondary_outcome.measure: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life (EORTC QLQ-C30)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, at every cycle (Day -1, Day 1 of cycle before treatment), at the end of the treatment, and every 2 months during follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Tumor Related Symptoms (Pain, Dyspnea, Cough, Hemoptysis, Weight, and the Use of Opioids and Non-Opioids Analgesics)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment

intervention.description: etoposide 100 mg/m2 days 1, 2 and 3 cisplatin 80 mg/m2 day 1 3 week cycle
irinotecan 65 mg/m2 day 1 and 8 cisplatin 80mg/m2 day 1 3 week cycle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically proven Small Cell Lung Cancer (SCLC)
- WHO performance status : 0, 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- No previous radiotherapy is allowed except on bone metastases when newly diagnosed. Radiotherapy is not allowed for vena cava syndrome, a stent is recommended ;
- No prior surgery on the primary tumor except for palliative purpose (stent for vena cava syndrome).

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Enrollment of Cohort 1 was terminated early per protocol amendment (29 September 2003). With limited number of subjects in Cohort 1, the efficacy analysis was exploratory. The amendment reduced Irinotecan dose from 80 to 65 mg/m2. With the study powered for Overall Survival in subjects recruited thereafter (Cohort 2) efficacy analysis is reported.

group.title: Irinotecan + Cisplatin (Cohort 1)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 ‚Äì 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Etoposide + Cisplatin (Cohort 1)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Irinotecan + Cisplatin (Cohort 2)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 65 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 - 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Etoposide + Cisplatin (Cohort 2)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Irinotecan + Cisplatin (Cohort 1)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 ‚Äì 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Etoposide + Cisplatin (Cohort 2)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.description: Protocol amendment (29 September 2003) reduced Irinotecan dose from 80 to 65mg/m2. Subjects recruited prior to amendment were referred to as Cohort 1; those afterwards were referred to as Cohort 2.

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Protocol amendment (29 September 2003) reduced Irinotecan dose from 80 to 65mg/m2. Subjects recruited prior to amendment were referred to as Cohort 1; those afterwards were referred to as Cohort 2.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) for the Full Analysis Population (FAP)
outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause. For a subject not expiring, the OS time was censored on the last date of contact that they were known to be alive. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death (every 3 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months for a minimum of 13 months post study treatment)
outcome.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients)analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer. The enrollment of Cohort 1 was terminated early per protocol amendment (29 September 2003). With limited number of subjects in Cohort 1, the efficacy analysis was exploratory.

group.title: Irinotecan + Cisplatin (Cohort 1)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 ‚Äì 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Etoposide + Cisplatin (Cohort 2)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS) for the Full Analysis Population (FAP)
measure.description: OS was defined as the time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause. For a subject not expiring, the OS time was censored on the last date of contact that they were known to be alive. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
measure.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients)analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer. The enrollment of Cohort 1 was terminated early per protocol amendment (29 September 2003). With limited number of subjects in Cohort 1, the efficacy analysis was exploratory.

analysis.groups_desc: A non-inferiority test was combined with a superiority test based on a closed testing procedure. The null hypothesis was to be rejected if the lower bound of the 2-sided 95% confidence interval for the hazard ratio (control/test) estimated from a Cox proportional hazards model, with an indicator for the control arm, was less than 0.80.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Overall Confirmed Response
outcome.description: Objective disease response = subjects with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). A CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. A PR was defined as a ‚â• 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to first documentation of confirmed response (every 9 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months in follow up until progression)
outcome.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients)analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer. The enrollment of Cohort 1 was terminated early per protocol amendment (29 September 2003). With limited number of subjects in Cohort 1, the efficacy analysis was exploratory.

group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 ‚Äì 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Overall Confirmed Response
measure.description: Objective disease response = subjects with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). A CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. A PR was defined as a ‚â• 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
measure.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients)analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer. The enrollment of Cohort 1 was terminated early per protocol amendment (29 September 2003). With limited number of subjects in Cohort 1, the efficacy analysis was exploratory.

outcome.title: Overall Survival for the Per Protocol (PP) Population
outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause. For a subject not expiring, the OS time was censored on the last date of contact that they were known to be alive. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death (every 3 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months for a minimum of 13 months post study treatment)
outcome.population: PP population = a subset of the Cohort 2 FAP. The subjects had to be eligible (subject had no major protocol deviations from inclusion and noninclusion criteria), evaluable for response, without any major protocol deviations during the study.

group.title: Irinotecan + Cisplatin (Cohort 2)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 65 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 ‚Äì 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Etoposide + Cisplatin (Cohort 2)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

measure.title: Overall Survival for the Per Protocol (PP) Population
measure.description: OS was defined as the time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause. For a subject not expiring, the OS time was censored on the last date of contact that they were known to be alive. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
measure.population: PP population = a subset of the Cohort 2 FAP. The subjects had to be eligible (subject had no major protocol deviations from inclusion and noninclusion criteria), evaluable for response, without any major protocol deviations during the study.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A non-inferiority test was combined with a superiority test based on a closed testing procedure. The null hypothesis was to be rejected if the lower bound of the 2-sided 95% confidence interval for the hazard ratio (control/test) estimated from a Cox proportional hazards model, with an indicator for the control arm, was less than 0.80.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: DR was defined as the time from start of the first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR) to the first documentation of objective tumor progression. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to first documentation of confirmed response (every 9 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months in follow up until progression)
outcome.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients) of Cohort 2 (after the 29 September 2003 protocol amendment), analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer.

group.title: Irinotecan + Cisplatin (Cohort 1)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 ‚Äì 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 65 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 - 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

group.title: Etoposide + Cisplatin (Cohort 2)
group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of: Etoposide 100 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR)
measure.description: DR was defined as the time from start of the first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR) to the first documentation of objective tumor progression. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
measure.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients) of Cohort 2 (after the 29 September 2003 protocol amendment), analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer.

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: TTP was defined as the time from date of randomization to the date of the first documentation of tumor progression. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of progression (every 9 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment and every 2 months for a minimum of 13 months post study treatment until progression)
outcome.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients)analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer. The enrollment of Cohort 1 was terminated early per protocol amendment (29 September 2003). With limited number of subjects in Cohort 1, the efficacy analysis was exploratory.

group.description: Each chemotherapy cycle was repeated every 21 days (3 weeks) and consisted of : Irinotecan hydrochloride 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30 ‚Äì 90 minutes on Day 1 and Day 8 followed by cisplatin 80 mg/m2 administered intravenously (IV) over 30-60 minutes on Day 1.

measure.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP)
measure.description: TTP was defined as the time from date of randomization to the date of the first documentation of tumor progression. The Kaplan-Meier method was used to analyze variables of duration and event associated with possible censoring and estimate the medians survival by treatment groups. The confidence intervals for the medians were calculated using the Brookmeyer and Crowley‚Äôs method.
measure.population: FAP = Full analysis population (all treated patients)analyzed in the arm they were assigned by randomization, assuming they had a confirmed small cell lung cancer. The enrollment of Cohort 1 was terminated early per protocol amendment (29 September 2003). With limited number of subjects in Cohort 1, the efficacy analysis was exploratory.

outcome.title: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life (EORTC QLQ-C30)
outcome.description: The EORTC QLQ-C30 scales include 5 functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), a global health status/QL scale and 9 symptom scales: nausea and vomiting, pain, fatigue, dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea and financial difficulties. All scales and single-item measures range from 0 to 100. A high score for a functional scale represents a high/healthy level of functioning, for the global health status/QL represents a high QL (better patient state), and for a symptom scale/item represents a high level of symptomatology/problems (worse patient state).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, at every cycle (Day -1, Day 1 of cycle before treatment), at the end of the treatment, and every 2 months during follow-up

measure.title: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life (EORTC QLQ-C30)
measure.description: The EORTC QLQ-C30 scales include 5 functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), a global health status/QL scale and 9 symptom scales: nausea and vomiting, pain, fatigue, dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea and financial difficulties. All scales and single-item measures range from 0 to 100. A high score for a functional scale represents a high/healthy level of functioning, for the global health status/QL represents a high QL (better patient state), and for a symptom scale/item represents a high level of symptomatology/problems (worse patient state).

outcome.title: Tumor Related Symptoms (Pain, Dyspnea, Cough, Hemoptysis, Weight, and the Use of Opioids and Non-Opioids Analgesics)
outcome.description: Improvement of ‚â• 1 tumor related symptom = clinical benefit responder. Pain improvement = decrease of ‚â• 1 National Cancer Institute (NCI) grade from baseline of ‚â• 1 symptom of NCI pain category, without pain symptom worsening. Cough, dyspnea and hemoptysis improvement = decrease of ‚â• 1 NCI grade from baseline. Positive weight change ‚â• 5 percent gain from baseline. Positive analgesic consumption = change from baseline from opioid to non-opioid category.
outcome.time_frame: Every 3 weeks for up to 6 months on study treatment

event.sub_title: Hand and foot syndrome secondary to sickle cell anaemia

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
